content: IIIT-Delhi Skip to main content -A A A+ AA Rajiv Raman Rajiv Raman Associate Professor (CSE, Math) PhD (2007), University of Iowa, USA Contact Details 011-26907573 rajiv@iiitd.ac.in Web Profile B-507 (R&D Block) Profile My primary area of research is algorithms. I am interested in the design and analysis of algorithms for problems in various domains such as scheduling, resource allocation, graph colouring and geometry. I also have an interest in the development of efficient practical heuristics for real-life problems. I obtained a PhD degree in Computer Science from the University of Iowa in 2007. Since then, I worked as a postdoctoral fellow at the Max-Planck institute for informatics in Germany, and at the centre for Discrete Mathematics and Applications at the University of Warwick. I also worked briefly at TCS Innovation labs before joining IIIT in 2012. Research Interests Algorithms Combinatorial Optimization Graph Theory discrete and computational geometry Teaching Interests AlgorithmsDiscrete mathematics Optimization Graph theory Affiliated Centres & Labs
